articles.title: Understanding VIX: The Market's Fear Gauge
articles.description: VIX measures 30-day forward SPX implied volatility. VIX < 15 = complacency, VIX > 30 = fear/panic. Historical analysis: VIX mean = 19.5, median = 17.3. VIX spikes (>40) occurred in 2008, 2020, and brief periods in 2022. Term structure matters: Contango (front < back) = normal, backwardation (front > back) = stress. Trade implications: Mean reversion trades work when VIX > 25.

articles.title: SKEW Index: Tail Risk and Black Swan Events
articles.description: SKEW measures tail risk (probability of 3+ standard deviation moves). SKEW = 100 means no tail risk, SKEW > 135 indicates elevated tail risk. Current levels (2025): SKEW = 147 (elevated). Historical: Pre-crash periods often see SKEW > 145. Trading application: High SKEW → buy OTM puts for protection. Low SKEW → sell OTM puts for premium. SKEW spikes preceded 2008, 2020 crashes.

key_insights: High SKEW → buy OTM puts, Low SKEW → sell OTM puts

articles.title: Put-Call Ratio: Sentiment Indicator
articles.description: CBOE Put/Call Ratio = Put Volume / Call Volume. Ratio > 1.0 = bearish sentiment (more puts), Ratio < 0.7 = bullish sentiment (more calls). Contrarian indicator: Extreme readings (>1.2 or <0.6) signal reversals. 2020-2025 average: 0.85. Application: P/C > 1.15 for 3+ days = oversold (buy signal), P/C < 0.65 for 3+ days = overbought (caution).

articles.title: Options Market Structure: How Liquidity Works
articles.description: Market makers provide liquidity via bid-ask spreads. Wide spreads = illiquid (avoid), Tight spreads = liquid (tradeable). SPX options: Most liquid (0.05-0.10 spreads), Individual stocks: Variable liquidity. Best execution: Trade during market hours (9:30-4pm ET), avoid first/last 15 minutes. Size matters: >100 contracts may require block trades to avoid moving market.

key_insights: Market makers provide liquidity via bid-ask spreads
Large orders (>100 contracts) may need block trades

articles.title: 0DTE Options: Same-Day Expiration Trading
articles.description: 0DTE (Zero Days to Expiration) options expire same day. Characteristics: Extreme theta decay, high gamma risk, massive volume (50% of SPX volume). Strategies: (1) Sell premium at open, close by 2pm. (2) Fade extremes: Sell calls/puts after big moves. Risk: Gamma explosions can cause fast losses. Position sizing: 0.5-1% account max. Best for experienced traders only.

key_insights: Extreme theta decay, high gamma risk
